feed.title: Red Butte Garden
feed.subtitle: The official website of Red Butte Garden

entry.title: GARDEN POETRY READING
entry.content:
Celebrate spring and go on a walk through the Garden with the winners of our spring poetry contest! Throughout the month of April the Garden is hosting 11 poetry boxes, showcasing works from local poets in honor of National Poetry Month. Stroll the Garden with the poets to hear live readings and gain details about the meaning behind their words.

Authors in attendance will include:

  • Megan Olsen
  • Maya Johnson
  • Melinda Birrell
  • Sara Bybee
  • Tina Thomas
  • Pam Tucker
  • Joyce Marder
  • Christina Elizabeth
  • Carol Anderson
  • Julie Chytraus
  • Acacia Ott

REGISTRATION REQUIRED

SOLD OUT! Click Below To Be Added to Waiting List
entry.summary: Celebrate spring and go on a walk through the Garden with the winners of our spring poetry contest! Throughout the month of April the Garden is hosting 11 poetry boxes, showcasing works from local poets in honor of National Poetry Month. Stroll the Garden with the poets to hear live readings and gain details about the meaning behind their words.

entry.title: Welcome Spring 2017!
entry.content:
What a great time of year spring is. The blanket of snow melts and reveals the buds and blossoms we all look forward to.

Yes, it's that time! Our daffodils are up and looking fantastic!

Leonard Messel Magnolia    Magnolia x stellata 'Leonard Messel'

This beauty is hard to miss as you enter the Courtyard.

Silver Bouquet Lungwort    Pulmonaria 'Silver Bouquet'

A lover of shade, this perennial is planted under the trees along the upper Floral Walk.

Royal Star Magnolia    Magnolia stellata 'Royal Star'

As you stroll down the Floral Walk, these show stoppers are sure to catch your eye.

Wisley Daffodil    Narcissus 'Wisley'

Red Butte Garden is home to more than 160 cultivars of Daffodil. How many can you count?

Browse Milkvetch    Astragalus cibarius

Why not go for a hike in the Natural Area and enjoy our native flora?

The weather is getting warmer and the days longer, why not come check out what Red Butte has to offer.

Photos by Jason W. Baker
entry.summary: What a great time of year spring is. The blanket of snow melts and reveals the buds and blossoms we all look forward to.

entry.title: Behind the Scenes
entry.content:
Here is a sneak peak of behind the scenes and inside of our Greenhouses, which is where the magic begins at Red Butte Garden.

Greenhouse

Hart's Tongue Fern    Asplenium scolopendrium

This is the underside of a fern leaf. The tiny black round specks are spores, which can be thought of as seeds of a fern, and they are what will develop into a mature plant.

Venus Slipper    Paphiopedilum sukhakulii x roebelenii

Rain Tree    Brunfelsia sp.

This tree's flowers exude a pleasant sweet scent.

Chinese Hibiscus    Hibiscus rosa-sinensis

Moth Orchid    Phalaenopsis sp.

Mexican Flame Vine    Senecio confusus

Queen's Tears   Billbergia nutans

I hope you enjoyed your sneak peak at behind the scenes of Red Butte Garden. We hope to see you soon!

Photos by, Heidi Simper
entry.summary: Here is a sneak peak of behind the scenes and inside of our Greenhouses, which is where the magic begins at Red Butte Garden.

entry.title: The Splendor of December
entry.content:
We are now half way through December. Are you wondering if there is any color left here at Red Butte Garden? Well wonder no more. Take a look at the photos below, better yet, come to the Garden to see for yourself!

Nannyberry Viburnum    Viburnum lentago

You better hurry to see these vibrant fruits, they won't be able to hang on for much longer.

Orangerie Living Wall

While at the Garden, take a break from the cold and stop inside the Orangerie to see the Living Wall, you won't be sorry.

Korean Barberry    Berberis koreana

This bush is raining red berries!

European Cranberrybush Viburnum    Viburnum opulus

You can't miss these bright berries in the Medicinal Garden!

Here at Red Butte Garden we keep our pathways clear of snow and ice, so come see the Garden and behold its winter splendor.
Photos by Heidi Simper
entry.summary: We are now half way through December. Are you wondering if there is any color left here at Red Butte Garden? Well wonder no more. Take a look at the photos below, better yet, come to the Garden to see for yourself!

entry.title: The Fruits of Winter
entry.content:
Winter is definitely here making the Garden a snowy wonderland. Some plants retain their fruit throughout the winter, and with a backdrop of white, the colors of the fruit really stand out this time of year.

Golden Spirit® Smokebush   Cotinus coggygria 'Ancot'

This golden-leaved shrub often retains some of its wispy fruits into the first part of winter.

Worplesdon Sweet Gum   Liquidambar styraciflua 'Worplesdon'

After the fantastic fall foliage falls, spiky fruits remain, bringing winter interest.

Skunkbrush Sumac   Rhus trilobata

This attractive Utah native can retain fruit from many past seasons of growth.

Sweet Autumn Clematis   Clematis terniflora

Long after the warmth of fall is gone, these delicate fruits decorate the dormant stems.

Creeping Oregon Grape   Mahonia repens

Another great Utah native, this shrub is not only easy to grow, it has something to show during every season.

When you come for your winter walk through the Garden, watch for a variety of wildlife harvesting the various fruits that remain on our trees and shrubs.

Stay warm!

Photos by Jason W. Baker
entry.summary: Winter is definitely here making the Garden a snowy wonderland. Some plants retain their fruit throughout the winter, and with a backdrop of white, the colors of the fruit really stand out this time of year.

entry.title: Enthralled with Fall
entry.content:
Come enjoy the sweater weather in this November. You are sure to be captivated by the Garden's vibrance.

Oregon Grape   Mahonia repens

This small shrub appears to be on fire when struck by the sun.

Bright Fantasy™ Snowberry   Symphoricarpos 'Bokrabright'

Along the Orangerie Boardwalk, this bush is brimming with fruit!

Koreanspice Viburnum    Viburnum carlesii

What fantastic red leaves!

Iceberg Rose   Rosa 'KORbin'

This elegant beauty is still in full bloom!

Bartlett Pear   Pyrus communis 'Bartlett'

The Pear Arbor is sure colorful right now!
This sunny weather won't last much longer, so don't delay your visit to the Garden.
Photos by Heidi Simper
entry.summary: Come enjoy the sweater weather in this November. You are sure to be captivated by the Garden's vibrance.

entry.title: Fall is Still Blooming!
entry.content:
Have you found yourself wondering if there are still any flowers blooming at Red Butte Garden? Wonder no more, the answer is yes!

Ryan's Pink Mum    Chrysanthemum 'Ryan's Pink'

This delight is in full bloom in the Fragrance Garden!

Gro-low Fragrant Sumac    Rhus aromatica 'Gro-low'

Not only are there flowers still blooming but also fall foliage galore. As you can see, this time of year is this shrubs time to shine.

Hybrid Toadlily    Tricyrtis x 'Sinome'

These attractive blooms can be seen along the Floral Walk

Cranesbill    Geranium 'Rozanne'

These jet-blue flowers have been blooming for a while now!

Sugar Buzz TM Bee Balm    Monarda 'Cotton Candy'

Minty fragrant leaves of this beauty make a great tea!

Dwarf Velvet Sage    Salvia leucantha 'Santa Barbara'

These bright flowers really stand out in the fall!

Come to Red Butte Garden to see all of the late bloomers as well as the spectacular fall foliage.
Photos by Heidi Simper
entry.summary: Have you found yourself wondering if there are still any flowers blooming at Red Butte Garden? Wonder no more, the answer is yes!

entry.content: This is a test. Stuff for communications will go here. :)

entry.title: Fall Has it All!
entry.content:
Flowers, fruit, leaves, insects, and cooler weather! Thanks to Fall, Red Butte Garden has it all! Now is a good time to visit the Garden to see plants in all various life stages.


Zagreb Tickseed    Coreopsis verticillata 'Zagreb'

This little beauty can be seen in the Rose Garden.

Rose Garden

As you can see, the Rose Garden is still blooming with color. Don't believe me or this photo? Come visit the Rose Garden to see for yourself and be prepared to be delighted!

Japanese Maple    Acer palmatum 'Sangokaku'

It's a wasp! It's a bee! No wait, it's a fly! It's a bee mimic fly! This harmless fly is able to appear dangerous thanks to it's clever imitation of a bee.

Maple Leaf Alumroot    Heuchera villosa 'Autumn Bride'

Now this is a bee. In comparison to the previous photo, can you see the difference? Despite the cooler weather, this plant is still buzzing with bees.

Engagement Garden

Beautiful contrasting leaf colors are developing all over the Garden, especially in the Engagement Garden. Stay tuned though, as Fall progresses the colors will get much more vibrant.

Curl-leaf Mountain Mahogany   Cercocarpus ledifolius

A seed with a twist! The fuzzy and twisted tail on this Utah native's seed makes it easier for the wind to disperse.

Copper Spine Prickly Pear    Opuntia littoralis var. martiniana

What amazingly bright and edible fruit this cactus has! The Fall show is not one you want to miss, so don't delay your visit to the Garden any longer.

Photos by Heidi Simper
entry.summary: Flowers, fruit, leaves, insects, and cooler weather! Thanks to Fall, Red Butte Garden has it all! Now is a good time to visit the Garden to see plants in all various life stages.

entry.title: Fantastic Fall Flowers
entry.content:
Fall is officially here and every corner of the Garden is filled with color.

Paper Bark Maple   Acer griseum

Look for the beautiful peeling bark of this Maple along the Floral Walk and near the Amphitheatre

Woods' Light Blue Aster   Aster 'Woods' Light Blue'

Plant Asters in your garden to give bees the nectar they need in the fall.

Chocolate Snakeroot   Eupatorium rugosum 'Chocolate'

These pure white flowers can be found growing under the Pear Arbors.

Ornamental Oregano   Origanum 'Bristol Cross'

This low-growing Oregano looks great in any location.

Oriental Fountain Grass   Pennisetum orientale

Plant grasses in your garden to bring a feathery texture to your garden.

Double Delight™ Rose   Rosa 'ANDeli'

Exposure UV light stimulates the white petals to change red.

Woods' Rose   Rosa woodsii

The hips of this native rose are a great food source for birds during the winter.

The leaves are changing, the grasses are stunning, and the temperature is mild, making right now a great time to visit Red Butte Garden.
Photos by Jason Baker
entry.summary: Fall is officially here and every corner of the Garden is filled with color.
